Legal_Issue: Whether Apotex's allegation of non-infringement is justified
Evidence_Assessment: Experiments showing partial conversion of anhydrate to hemihydrate were deemed inconclusive due to experimental conditions and lack of specificity
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant (SmithKline) to prove infringement on a balance of probabilities
Credibility_Factor: Lack of specificity and reliability in experimental data
Legal_Rule: A party alleging non-infringement must provide sufficient facts; the applicant must prove the allegation is not justified
Procedural_Issue: Filing of prohibition application under NOC regulations
Grounds_for_Claim: Potential infringement of patented crystalline form of paroxetine hydrochloride hemihydrate
Applicant_Challenge: SmithKline challenged Apotex's generic product launch
Court_Result: Allowed Apotex to proceed with product launch
Defendant_Response: Apotex alleged non-infringement based on insufficient evidence of conversion
Outcome: Remedy denied; Apotex permitted to launch product
Remedy_Sought: Interlocutory injunction to prevent market entry
Legal_Provision: Section 6 of the Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Allegation of non-infringement supported due to lack of conclusive proof
